answerText: aquifers[10] This term refers to confined aquifers with positive pressure. It can also refer to wells made that tap such an aquifer and which can appear to produce water naturally.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Michigan B and Yale A | 19 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These entities are called unconfined when their upper boundary is water that is present above ground, such as a stream or an oasis. For 10 points each: [10] Name these layers of water-containing material in the earth's crust.
